{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3639432,"name":"","username":"Gilchen","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/87869e/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-05-29T11:06:51.823Z","cooked":"

Hi,
As a FRC team, we have 20 SW2024 licenses (desktop).

I’m looking for a way to manage these licenses, mainly:

  1. Generate a list of all computers that use this license
  2. A tool that can transfer a license from one computer to another.

Is there a way to support these actions?
Is there a Solidworks support email address for FRC teams?

Thanks in advance,
Chen

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-05-29T11:06:51.823Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":14,"reads":171,"readers_count":170,"score":104.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":502537,"topic_slug":"solidworks-license-management-tool","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":73799,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/solidworks-license-management-tool/502537/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3639444,"name":"Patrick","username":"Patrick3357","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/patrick3357/{size}/169915_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-29T11:27:50.647Z","cooked":"

How are you getting your licenses and why do you need to transfer them? Most likely, by far the easiest solution to your problem is to get more licenses. We request significantly more licenses than we have CAD users so that we don’t have to worry about it when people want to install solidworks on multiple computers.

If you have some other reason you need license management you’re looking for SolidNetWork License Manager. I don’t know if you can get that through educational licenses.

Thanks Patrick for your prompt reply.
the licenses are received through some kind of an agreement (I guess) between FIRST and SolidWorks, based on an online license request form (IteropExternal). As I understand, if the request is approved, 20 licenses are received. How do you request more licenses? Do you request licenses via other form?
We have a classroom with 20 PCs to learn SW and we also have a few additional ones in the lab and the manufacturing room.

I’m not the person on our team who actually gets the licenses, so I’m not sure exactly what the process is. @Malmojtaba may be able to help.

I didn’t apply for the solidworks sponsorship this year, so perhaps they changed the process for the 2024/2025 season; But it used to be when applying, they’d ask how many seats you need (this was in the online form you referred to). I usually put about double the number of students we had, typically about 70 seats, for similar reasons Patrick mentioned above.

Hi Chen,

It looks like you got your licenses through our official sponsorship page. That’s great!

SOLIDWORKS licenses for FRC teams are free. To request more seats, resubmit the exact same form with the number of licenses you need. You will be sent licenses for the most up to date version of the software (currently SW25). Know that we automatically include a buffer of extra seats because we understand that additional members may join the team mid-season.

Be aware that these licenses can only be installed on personal computers or dedicated team PCs, and cannot be installed on classroom computers. This competes with our VARs (Value Added Resellers) and the paid educational license.

Also be aware that licenses expire 2 years from the version year you have, on July 31st. So licenses of SW24 will expire on July 31st, 2026. You will need to resubmit the application form each year to get the latest version, though.

To transfer licenses to another computer, you will need to deactivate and uninstall it from the current machine and reinstall/reactivate on the new machine. Be sure to write down your license number before you begin this process so you don’t lose it! This article is written by one of our VARs and walks you through the steps.

The contact form for the student support team is on this webpage. You will need to create a login, if you do not have one already.

image1580×448 37.1 KB

Happy modeling!

Great.
Thanks for the info and guidance. I’ll follow the instructions. Now I also know how to get a direct support from SW.
Thanks to all.
